attributes.action: COMMEMORATE MEMORY OF POLISH GENERALS SERVED IN POLISH ARMED FORCES UNDER BRITISH COMMAND
attributes.additional_details: Please commemorate memory Polish generals as Sosnkowski Maczek Sosabowski Rudnicki Sulik Kopanski by local councils in London by giving them name of streets and blue plaque as they served during WWII under British command In my opinion this is apropriate way to appreciate theirs fight  After war they have been abandoned forgotten by British and end as a common people or workers Some of them was blamed unjustified by faults of British command like gen Sosabowski in operation Market Garden some like gen Sosnkowski was discriminate for own views by British authority This must be revised and they must be at last theirs names clear All of them was good brave people loyal Allies Please remember not only Polish airman who saved UK but also this soldiers and theirs generals who fought on field and sea They fought just remind you in Monte Cassino like my ancestor  Tobruk Narvik Falaise Normandy Please remember them also
